> Tucson nodds to Vestige, and suddenly comes up with an idea. He=
 still could move swiftly and dexterously, thanks to his ninjabot training.=
 If ever a time where it was needed it was now. He looks around quickly and=
 notices that a formation of old metal debris lying on rubble resembles a t=
eeter toter lever. which he knew he could use as a vaulting platform. It wo=
uld just take a second individual to step on the other end to send him upwa=
rd for his maneuver. He points to it.
>
> " See that? It resembles a catapo=
ult lever. One individual stands on one end, while the other jumps on the o=
ther end to send the first individual airbourne. From there, I'm sure I can=
 make it to the bed. It's an old Ninjabot trick I learned during training. =
And if I play my cards right, it'll be a maneuver they don't see comming."
=
>
> With that he draws his sword, keeping an eye on the insects.

<NEW>

Ve=
stige nodded as he glanced at the piece of metal that lay on the
floor and =
then back at Tuscon. The piece of metal was actually armor
plating that had=
 been part of the wall before the fire fight had
started. Now it lay discar=
ded on the floor, laying haphazardly on top
of debris, ready for Tuscon and=
 Vestige's use.

"I see." Vestige said said, his optics clear and focused. =
Turning he
launched a few more shots on the approaching insectoids, thier a=
rmor
absorbing the brunt of his attacks, but even now begining to burn and
=
scorch. However Vestige took the moment to get into position.

The insects =
approach Tuscon warily, thier multifaceted optics looking
at his sword, thi=
er tail mounted cannons oriented on it and him.

"You cannot succeed Autobo=
t!" Says the voice of the insecoids, "We are
the hoard, surrender now."

Th=
e insectoids quickly begin to close on Tuscon's position, thier

pering the area around him with firepower and explosive
